results.title: ASSOCIATION OF METFORMIN USE WITH RISK OF NEWLY ONSET NEOVASCULAR AGE-RELATED MACULAR DEGENERATION DEVELOPMENT.
results.text_hl: ASSOCIATION OF @<m>CHEMICAL_Metformin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008687 @@@METFORMIN@@@ USE WITH RISK OF NEWLY ONSET NEOVASCULAR @<m>DISEASE_613784</m> @DISEASE_OMIM:613784 @@@AGE-RELATED MACULAR@@@ DEGENERATION DEVELOPMENT.

results.title: In Vitro Antiglycation and Methylglyoxal Trapping Effect of Peppermint Leaf (Mentha x piperita L.) and Its Polyphenols
results.text_hl: Under analogous conditions, the antidiabetic @<m>CHEMICAL_Metformin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008687 @@@metformin@@@ inhibited glycation by 52.3% +- 13.8%.

citations.NLM: Fecka I, Bednarska K, Kowalczyk A. In Vitro Antiglycation and Methylglyoxal Trapping Effect of Peppermint Leaf (Mentha x piperita L.) and Its Polyphenols Molecules. 2023 Mar 22;28(6):. PMID: 36985839
citations.BibTeX: @article{36985839, title={In Vitro Antiglycation and Methylglyoxal Trapping Effect of Peppermint Leaf (Mentha x piperita L.) and Its Polyphenols}, author={Fecka I and Bednarska K and Kowalczyk A}, journal={Molecules}, volume={28}, number={6}}

results.title: Investigation of the Dysfunction Caused by High Glucose, Advanced Glycation End Products, and Interleukin-1 Beta and the Effects of Therapeutic Agents on the Microphysiological Artery Model.
results.text_hl: @<m>CHEMICAL_Metformin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008687 @@@Metformin@@@ and @CHEMICAL_diphenyleneiodonium @CHEMICAL_MESH:C007517 @@@diphenyleneiodonium@@@ mitigated high-@CHEMICAL_Glucose @CHEMICAL_MESH:D005947 @@@glucose@@@- and @<m>DISEASE_613784</m> @DISEASE_OMIM:613784 @@@AGE@@@-associated pathological changes, whereas @CHEMICAL_Atorvastatin @CHEMICAL_MESH:D000069059 @@@atorvastatin@@@ affected only the morphology of ECs.

citations.NLM: Nam U, Kim J, Yi HG, Jeon JS. Investigation of the Dysfunction Caused by High Glucose, Advanced Glycation End Products, and Interleukin-1 Beta and the Effects of Therapeutic Agents on the Microphysiological Artery Model. Adv Healthc Mater. 2024 Apr 4;():e2302682. PMID: 38575148
